params.name: storeacl
params.description:
Access Control List (ACL) to use for new files. Can be a either a string (`"authenticated-read"`, `"private"`, `"public-read"`, or `"public-read-write"`), or
an array of structs where each struct represents a permission or grant.

Example:
```[{email="xxx@yyy.com", permission="full_control"}, {group="all", permission="read"}]```

Defaults to the value specified in the application's `this.s3.acl`, which is `"public"` if unspecified.

params.name: action
params.description:
Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

- info [[function-fileinfo]]
- move [[function-filemove]]
- rename
- copy [[function-filecopy]]
- delete [[function-filedelete]]
- read [[function-fileread]]
- readbinary [[function-filereadbinary]]
- write [[function-filewrite]]
- append [[function-fileappend]]
- upload [[function-fileupload]]
- uploadall [[function-fileuploadall]]
- touch [[function-filetouch]]
 
**Note:** action upload return the [[file-upload-result| status of the upload operation ]]  as a struct after the file upload

params.name: serverpassword
params.description: allow you to access filesystem, also when access is denied for your context

params.name: source
params.description:
Absolute pathname of file on web server.
On Windows, use backward slashes; on UNIX, use forward slashes.

params.name: attributes
params.description:
One attribute (Windows) or a comma-delimited list of attributes (other platforms) to set on the file.

If omitted, the file's attributes are maintained.

params.name: destination
params.description: Absolute pathname of directory or file on web server.

params.name: mode
params.description: Applies only to Solaris and HP-UX. Permissions. Octal values of UNIX chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

params.name: filefield
params.description: Name of form field used to select the file.

params.name: charset
params.description: Character set name for the file contents.

params.name: nameconflict
params.description:
Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file in the directory.

- skip
- error
- overwrite
- makeunique
- forceunique

params.name: accept
params.description: list of supported extensions or/and mimetypes.

params.name: strict
params.description:
for action "upload" and "uploadAll":

if set to true (default), only mimetypes are supported.

params.name: createpath
params.description:
for action "append", "touch" and "write":

if set to false (default), expects all parent directories to exist, true will generate necessary directories

params.name: file
params.description: Absolute pathname of file on web server.

params.name: variable
params.description: Name of variable to contain contents of text file.

params.name: output
params.description: Content of the file to be created.

params.name: cachedwithin
params.description:
possible values are:

- String "request": If original content was created within the current request, cached content data is used.
- a timespan (created with function CreateTimeSpan): If original content date falls within the time span, cached content data is used.

To use cached data, the tag must be called with the exact same arguments.

Only used by action "read" and "readbinary"

params.name: addnewline
params.description: Yes: appends newline character to text written to file

params.name: fixnewline
params.description:
- **true:** changes embedded line-ending characters in string variables to operating-system specific line endings
- **false:** (default) do not change embedded line-ending characters in string variables.

params.name: result
params.description: Name of the result value (default:cffile)

params.name: allowedextensions
params.description: String list or string array of extensions allowed, this overwrites any other setting including the attribute [blockedExtensions] and settings done for example in the Application.cfc.

params.name: blockedextensions
params.description: String list or string array of extensions blocked, this overwrites any setting done for example in the Application.cfc.
